DialogueOption.Text: Hey Slate, is there anything we haven't figured out yet?
Where are the hatchlings again?
What if I don't know there's ghost matter somewhere?

Dialogue.Page: Stars above, your suit tells you when there's ghost matter anywhere nearby!

Your suit has a built-in sensor that should alert you whenever there's ghost matter nearby at all - and you should be wearing that suit for oxygen at all times off-planet - so it's basically impossible to just run into a patch without warning.
Once you know there's ghost matter around, just use the scout to look out for it. You can even switch the scout to a handheld photo mode that lets you take pictures without launching it first.
I'd honestly be impressed if anyone died to ghost matter with all these tools - so just don't worry too much about the nebulous dangers of space, and take off already.

DialogueOption.Text: Hey Slate, is there anything we haven't figured out yet?
Where are the hatchlings again?

Dialogue.Page: Trying to solve some mysteries out there, are you? Sure, there's loads of things we don't know.
We don't know where Feldspar's gone, for one, or if they're even still alive. Ah, I miss my ship tester...
Don't know what happened to the Nomai either. You'd probably score a great exhibit in the museum if you could figure out what happened to the ancient species that once lived in our star system.
What else, what else... Oh, you seen that big Nomai station orbiting Giant's Deep? It's a pretty sight. Makes you wonder what it was built for, doesn't it?

DialogueOption.Text: Feldspar's alive! They're just stranded inside Dark Bramble.
The Nomai were killed by ghost matter that engulfed the star system from the Interloper.
The station orbiting Giant's Deep was built to shoot a probe to look for an entity older than the universe.
Any other mysteries we've never heard about?
Huh.. Guess I'll just keep trying to figure those out.

Dialogue.Page: Well? Any other answers to the mysteries of the universe come to you in your sleep?

DialogueOption.Text: Feldspar's alive! They're just stranded inside Dark Bramble.
The Nomai were killed by ghost matter that engulfed the star system from the Interloper.
The station orbiting Giant's Deep was built to shoot a probe to look for an entity older than the universe.
So... Is there anything we haven't figured out yet?
Any other mysteries we've never heard about?
Huh.. Guess I'll just keep trying to figure those out.

Dialogue.Page: Yeah, yeah, and Chert says Feldspar's probably buried in sand somewhere on the Hourglass Twins.. Sad as it sounds, I think I'm leaning more towards Chert's idea, hatchling.
Ghost matter killed the Nomai? Pfft, I've heard way more fancy theories about the Nomai from Riebeck, hatchling.
Entity older than the universe..? Hatchling, that sounds like hogwash. Has Gabbro been filling your head with too many stories of their daydreamed discoveries?
Really? None of those mysteries were enticing enough for ya?
Sheesh, even Gabbro was curious which planet was best for napping on.. Guess you can't draw a magnet to lead.
Well, you better figure out what you wanna explore before you take off. Otherwise, it'll be a pretty boring and pointless waste of fuel going into space.
.. Oh, I know!
Try asking the kids around the village what questions they have about space before you go! I'm sure they've got some weird little mysteries for you to tackle.

DialogueOption.Text: Why ask the kids?
What kind of mysteries would kids know about?

Dialogue.Page: Ha! I guess that's our biggest mysteries all solved in your dreams already, eh, hatchling? Nothing left to explore out there!
Well, you better figure out "what else" there is to explore before you take off. Otherwise, it'll be a pretty boring and pointless waste of fuel for you to go into space at all.
.. Ah, I know.
Try asking the kids around the village what questions they have about space before you go. I'm sure they've got some more weird little mysteries for you to tackle.

DialogueOption.Text: Why ask the kids?
What kind of mysteries would kids know about?

Dialogue.Page: Have you talked to a kid before? They're obnoxiously endless pools of curiosity. I'm sure one of them could give you some idea on what else to explore.
..Besides, if you talk to them now, it'd help to get them off my back later because the newest astronaut didn't say bye to them.
Just remember, there's five of those little squirts: Mica, Tephra, Galena, Arkose, and Moraine.
If you're out of questions, might as well answer somebody else's dumb questions about the universe, right?
Glad to hear it. Bring back some good campfire stories, hatchling!
Stars above, just look around the village! They're all probably playing around somewhere.
Mica's probably still fiddling with the model rocket, just up the hill.
Tephra and Galena are probably playing in the village somewhere?
I saw those two trekking outside the village recently for whatever reason though, so don't take my word on that.
Arkose's probably still throwing rocks into the patch of ghost matter at the top of the village. Still uh.. no idea why they do that all day.
And Moraine's probably stargazing on that big tree in the village, making sure Marl doesn't chop it down.
I wonder if that Marl'll ever let go of that grudge.. No good comes outta holding a grudge against a tree, y'know?
Just get a move on - you'll probably see 'em on the way up to the observatory for the launch codes anyways.
